channel.title: math.AC updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.AC updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Application of Betti Splittings to the Regularity of Binomial Edge Ideals
item.description: arXiv:2504.21550v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper, we use Betti splittings of binomial edge ideals to establish improved upper and lower bounds for their regularity in the case of trees. As a consequence, we determine the exact regularity for certain classes of trees.
item.dc:creator: Rajiv Kumar, Paramhans Kushwaha

item.title: Bounded powers of edge ideals: Gorenstein toric rings
item.description: arXiv:2504.21760v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: Let $S=K[x_1, \ldots,x_n]$ denote the polynomial ring in $n$ variables over a field $K$ and $I \subset S$ a monomial ideal. Given a vector $\mathfrak{c}\in\mathbb{N}^n$, the ideal $I_{\mathfrak{c}}$ is the ideal generated by those monomials belonging to $I$ whose exponent vectors are componentwise bounded above by $\mathfrak{c}$. Let $\delta_{\mathfrak{c}}(I)$ be the largest integer $q$ for which $(I^q)_{\mathfrak{c}}\neq 0$. For a finite graph $G$, its edge ideal is denoted by $I(G)$. Let $\mathcal{B}(\mathfrak{c},G)$ be the toric ring which is generated by the monomials belonging to the minimal system of monomial generators of $(I(G)^{\delta_{\mathfrak{c}}(I)})_{\mathfrak{c}}$. In a previous work, the authors proved that $(I(G)^{\delta_{\mathfrak{c}}(I)})_{\mathfrak{c}}$ is a polymatroidal ideal. It follows that $\mathcal{B}(\mathfrak{c},G)$ is a normal Cohen--Macaulay domain. In this paper, we study the Gorenstein property of $\mathcal{B}(\mathfrak{c},G)$.
item.dc:creator: Takayuki Hibi, Seyed Amin Seyed Fakhari

item.title: Every finitely generated abelian group is the class group of a generalized cluster algebra
item.description: arXiv:2411.14963v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We determine the class group of those generalized cluster algebras that are Krull domains. In particular, this provides a criterion for determining whether or not a generalized cluster algebra is a UFD. In fact, any finitely generated abelian group can be realized as the class group of a generalized cluster algebra. Additionally, we show that generalized cluster algebras are FF-domains and that their cluster variables are strong atoms. Finally, we examine the factorization and ring-theoretic properties of Laurent phenomenon algebras.
item.dc:creator: Mara Pompili

item.title: A Shape Lemma for Ideals of Differential Operators
item.description: arXiv:2502.11787v2 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We propose a version of the classical shape lemma for zero-dimensional ideals of a commutative multivariate polynomial ring to the noncommutative setting of zero-dimensional ideals in an algebra of differential operators.
item.dc:creator: Manuel Kauers, Christoph Koutschan, Thibaut Verron
